page.title: 04Transport
page.content: THERE USED TO BE A BRITISH RAIL STATION IN NEW RADNOR BUT THE LINE, WHICH WAS A BRANCH LINE FROM KINGTON AND ENDED IN NEW RADNOR, WAS CLOSED IN 1955. THERE IS A BUS SERVICE OPERATING AS FOLLOWS:_ ON TUESDAYS A COACH RUNS FROM LLANDRINDOD WELLS TO KINGTON VIA NEW RADNOR. THIS SERVICE RUNS TWICE IN EACH DIRECTION. A SIMILAR SERVICE RUNS ON SATURDAYS BUT ONLY ONCE IN EACH DIRECTION. ON THE FIRST WEDNESDAY OF EACH MONTH A COACH GOES FROM LLANDRINDOD WELLS TO HEREFORD VIA NEW RADNOR. EVERY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY BETWEEN EASTER AND OCTOBER A COACH TRAVELS FROM BIRMINGHAM THROUGH NEW RADNOR TO ABERYSTWYTH. THE RECENTLY FORMED RADNOR VALLEY TRAVEL CLUB ORGANISES COACH TRIPS FOR LOCAL INHABITANTS.
